comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content:
From cwgc: Name: LEE, JACK 
Nationality: Australian 
Rank: Private 
Regiment/Service: Australian Infantry, A.I.F. 
Unit Text: 24th Bn. 
Date of Death: 03/05/1917 
Service No: 4135 
Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead 
Memorial: VILLERS-BRETONNEUX MEMORIAL

comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content: Australian War Memorial (AWM) website have same photograph of him, the same information as CWGC above but also a location of his position on their war memorial buidling www.awm.gov.au/research/people/roll_of_honour/person.asp?... Also AWM, First World War Embarkation Roll Name: Lee, Jack, Service Number: 4135 Unit: 24 Infantry Battalion - 9 to 12 Reinforcements (February-April 1916)

comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content: AWM, Red Cross Wounded and Missing records. There is a digitized 7 page pdf document that outlines witness reports to his death, too much to write here. He was aged 22, possibly came from Victoria, his father was a farmer. Reports vary in exactness but it seems he was hit by a shell or one report thinks shot in the head. See www.awm.gov.au/research/people/wounded_and_missing/person... to read all the eyewitness accounts.

comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content: AWM - his basic service number details also listed on the FWW Nominal Roll Page AWM 133, 30-124 and also his date of enlistment of 16.12.15 www.awm.gov.au/research/people/nominal_rolls/first_world_...

comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content: recordsearch.naa.gov.au/NameSearch/Interface/ItemDetail.a... allows a digital copy of service record to be viewed. (39 pages, some repeats) He was born Carlton, Victoria. His next of kin is mother Mary Annie Paine, father deceased. Enslited at Melbourne, Victoria. A natural born British subject. Trade/calling: Canvas Cutter. Physical description: height - 5ft 2 3/4 inches, weight - 126lbs, Fresh complexion, Dark bronw eyes, brown hair. Distinctive marks included in list are moles (cheek and shoulder( and scars (shin, calf, knee)on . Medical record includes bout of influenza. Two instances of absent without leave. Letter from his mum giving consent for the necessary tests for his enlistment. In London Sep 1916. Inventory of effects sent to his mother include money case, wallet, letter carrier, cards, photos, letters and 2 military books with letter sent with them and return letter from mother accepting receipt of items. Copy of Kack Lee's will leaving everything to mother in event of his death. Memorila scroll, Victory medal, Memorial plaque.

comment.author: 22694125@N02
comment._content: Congratulations! This is a wonderful shot! You are invited to post it to: artland

comment.author: 41133925@N02
comment._content: He looks so young. What a waste. Being a stretcher bearer must have been grim. Going out under fire with nothing to shoot back with is brave in my book.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: The birth record for 1899 Carlton, Victoria shows only his mother's name as Mary Ann Lee which seems to imply he was illegitimate.
